thread.title: East Texas news briefs

author: Guest
title: East Texas news briefs
text:
Pilot in fatal East Texas plane crash identified
VAN ZANDT COUNTY — Authorities have identified a pilot killed in a fatal plane crash Tuesday in Van Zandt County.
Please purchase a subscription to read our premium content. If you have a subscription, please log in or sign up for an account on our website to continue.
Please log in, or sign up for a new account to continue reading.
Thank you for reading! We hope that you continue to enjoy our free content.
VAN ZANDT COUNTY — Authorities have identified a pilot killed in a fatal plane crash Tuesday in Van Zandt County.
At about 6 p.m., "a civilian aircraft crashed in the area of 114 Private Road 7005, Edgewood," according to a statement from the Texas Department of Public Safety. "The plane came to rest, striking a residence at the location and causing minor damage to the home. No one was in the home at the time of the plane crash."
DPS said the pilot of the plane, Roger D. Turner, 60, of Edgewood was later pronounced dead at a local medical center.
"Representatives from the Federal Aviation Administration and the National Transportation Safety Board are en route to the scene to conduct their investigation," the DPS said.
Edgewood is west of Mineola and north of Canton.
FORT WORTH — A Longview woman was hit and killed this past week near Dallas Fort Worth International Airport while waiting for a tow truck, according to Fort Worth police.
Susan Simmons, 57, and another woman were traveling southbound about 7 p.m. Dec. 21 from the airport "and slid off the roadway and down an embankment on the curve to go East on Hwy 183," Fort Worth police reported.
"Their vehicle got stuck in the mud, so they called a tow truck and walked up to the road to wait for it," police said. "They were standing on the edge of the road when a Toyota Tundra pickup ran off the road, striking both of them."
Simmons was pronounced dead at the scene, while the other woman was transported to a medical center.
Police did not identify the injured woman.
The pickup left the scene without stopping and will be missing the driver’s side rearview mirror, according to police.
According to her obituary, Simmons is survived by her husband, Paul Simmons of Longview, and three children.
HENDERSON — An East Texas school district is mourning the loss of a former superintendent who died on Christmas Eve.
Henderson ISD released a statement after the passing of Tommy Alexander, also known as Coach A.
"Mr. Alexander's 26-year tenure at HISD left an indelible mark on this community. As a coach, maintenance director, assistant superintendent, and finally as superintendent, his dedication to student success and the tradition of excellence was evident," the statement read. "He will be remembered for his commitment to our community and the incredible impact he had on generations of students and staff across East Texas."
Henderson ISD said their thoughts are with Alexander's family during this time and his legacy at the school district will not be forgotten.
From Staff Reports
